topics: Introduction, Definitions, course outline, software tools etc.
Data modeling – Linear regression, functions with linear coefficients, numerical integration and differentiation, …
Static Models – Boundary value problems, Initial value problems, boundary conditions, behavior of the medium, …
Numerical Solution to Boundary value problems – introduction to FEM.
Case Studies: Thermal Problem, Flow problem, Linear elasticity, flow, Coupled flow/thermal analysis
Dynamic Models – Transient Solutions – Simple ODES, coupled problems
Stochastic Models – Basic process models, advanced resource allocations and material flow control

grading.policies: Late Policy: +3 Days – 80% of the grade, +4-7 Days – 50% of the grade, > 7 Days – 0%

policies.late_work: Late Policy: +3 Days – 80% of the grade, +4-7 Days – 50% of the grade, > 7 Days – 0%
policies.academic_integrity: Students must sign the Honor System pledge on all submitted work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology provides accommodations for students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Software Needed: Solidworks Simulation / Flow Works, Matlab/Simulink, Arena.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers free and confidential services.

_metadata.course_description: Modeling and simulation is a dynamic field that is utilized in a wide range of physical and social sciences, engineering fields, health, business, education, and many other disciplines.
learning_outcomes: Build mathematical and logical modeling of physical systems and processes
Differentiate between static, dynamic and stochastic models; Apply appropriate approximations for physical problems
Simulate a variety of problems relevant to engineers
